body.name: Storkcraft Portofino 5-in-1 Convertible Crib and Changer (White) – Changing-Table Combo with Drawer, Converts to Toddler Bed, Daybed Full-Size Storage Drawer
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 3 hrs 51 mins
features: 5-IN-1 CONVERTIBLE CRIB: Converts from baby crib (mattress sold separately) to toddler bed (toddler guardrail sold separately), daybed, and full-size bed with headboard & optional footboard (conversion kit sold separately); Assembly required

ATTACHED CHANGING TABLE WITH STORAGE: Baby crib with traditional sleigh design for classic nursery style; Attached changing table includes 3 enclosed storage drawers, 2 open shelves, and water-resistant changing pad with safety strap

ADAPTS TO YOUR GROWING BABY: Adjustable mattress support base with 3 different height options; Designed to fit any standard full-size crib & toddler mattress; This baby crib may be used until your child can easily climb out or is taller than 35in (89cm)
JPMA CERTIFIED: Expert tested to meet or exceed all applicable category voluntary and mandatory safety standards

QUALITY CRAFTSMANSHIP: Crafted with pine wood, engineered wood, wood composites, and includes Euro drawer glides; Packaging tested to reduce the risk of incidental damage that could occur during shipment
body.description: A Storkcraft classic, the Portofino 5-in-1 Convertible Crib and Changer combines unsurpassed quality with style in a versatile package. Offering plenty of storage with its three spacious drawers and three open shelves, this crib and changer converts into a toddler bed (Storkcraft Toddler Guardrail sold separately), daybed and full size bed (Storkcraft Full-Size Crib Conversion Kit & Metal Bed Frame sold separately). Designed with safety in mind and constructed with quality pine wood and composites, the Storkcraft Portofino 5-in-1 Convertible Crib and Changer is available in multiple finishes. The Storkcraft Portofino 4-in-1 Convertible Crib and Changer is JPMA Certified and compliant with all applicable ASTM International and CPSC safety standards. Rest easy knowing that the Portofino is backed by Storkcraft's 1-year limited warranty and supportive customer care. Exclusively from Storkcraft, proud recipient of the 2023 Women's Choice Award for 9 out of 10 Customer Recommended Baby & kids furniture.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Storkcraft Tuscany 4-in-1 Convertible Crib The Storkcraft Tuscany 4-in-1 Convertible Crib is a timeless design that will add classic elegance to the nursery. Designed to adapt to your growing baby, the Storkcraft Tuscany 4-in-1 Convertible Crib is equipped with a 3-position adjustable mattress support base, and can convert from a crib into a daybed, toddler bed, and full-size bed.

4-in-1 Convertible Crib Crib This crib is designed to accommodate your growing child. It features a three-positioned adjustable mattress support base. Set the mattress at the middle or highest height for your new born baby. Toddler Bed With or without a safety guardrail, this crib will grow with your child as they transition into a toddler bed. The toddler bed stage is recommended once your child surpasses the height of 35 inches. Safety guardrail is sold separately. Daybed For added versatility, and as your child continues to grow, this crib converts into a daybed. Full Size Bed This crib will last well into adolescence as it converts into a full-size bed with headboard and footboard. Mattress and Storkcraft Full-Size Crib Metal Bed Frame Conversion Kit are sold separately.

Graco Premium Foam Crib and Toddler Mattress Graco Premium Contoured Changing Pad Storkcraft Aspen Changing Table Storkcraft Avalon 5 Drawer Dresser Storkcraft Toddler Guardrail Storkcraft Full-Size Metal Bed Frame Crib Conversion Kit Type of Nursery Item Crib and Toddler Mattress Changing Pad Changing Table Dresser Safety Guardrail Crib Conversion Kit Assembled Dimensions (Inches) 52 x 27.6 x 5 32 x 16 x 3 18.75 x 39.9 x 37.5 17.52 x 37.21 x 46.26 18.5 x 0.75 x 11.5 75.5 x 39.5-60.5 x 12 Weight (Ib) 7 1.46 36.26 46.26 1.45 23 Brief Description The Graco Premium Foam Crib & Toddler Bed Mattress is the ideal recommended firmness for infants, and is designed to fit any standard full-size crib and toddler bed. The Graco Premium Contoured Changing Pad was designed to make changing your baby a clean, safe, and secure process. Our all-new baby changing pad is made of a water-resistant material, that is easy to wipe clean and keep your baby dry. The Storkcraft Aspen Changing Table is a timeless addition to the nursery, brimming with convenient options to make "changing time" a breeze. The Storkcraft Avalon 5-Drawer Dresser is a spacious nursery and bedroom storage solution, featuring classic sleigh-style looks and ample storage. The Storkcraft Toddler Guardrail is designed to provide added protection during your baby's transition from the crib to the toddler bed. Extend the life of your Storkcraft crib into your not-so-little one’s childhood, teen years, and beyond. This kit will allow you to transform your Storkcraft 4-in-1 or 5-in-1 convertible crib into a full-size bed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A fantastic crib and changer at a fantastic price
reviews.reviewText: This was very easy for my husband to assemble and looks just as beautiful as in the photo. The espresso color matches our black-brown wooden furniture perfectly; it's a wonderful addition to our bedroom, and all the storage space it comes with (drawers in the front of the changer and shelving in the back) means not having to use any closet or dresser space for baby's things, and still having room for toys!The crib itself is very sturdy, but the changing table unfortunately won't support more than about 35 lbs of weight. Hopefully by then the little one is potty-trained anyway, but we're still going to err on the side of caution and stop using the top part of the storage compartment as a changer before then. The other issue we had with the changing station is that, as other reviewers have mentioned, the changing pad that comes with the crib is very hard and unpleasant, but it is very difficult to find a different pad to replace it that will actually fit on the changing table. Our solution was to simply "make" the Summer Infant Contoured Changing Pad (which I highly recommend -- it is very squishy and the covers are very soft and come in loads of colors) fit. With the bottom of the changing pad lined up with the bottom of the changing table (that little gap is too small for a changing pad to squish out of), we pushed the Summer Infant changing pad down so it was lying on the bottom of the changing table, which leaves about five inches extra in length curving upwards along the top. The result is basically a little elevation for the little one's head, like a gentle pillow. This works just fine for me, since I wasn't enthusiastic about baby potentially hitting his head on the bars in the back, and it still looks great.Overall these are such minor complaints compared to how awesome this crib is overall. You really can't beat the price for getting four children's beds, a dresser, a bookshelf, and a changing table all in one, especially with the quality with which it was designed. I spent months shopping around for just the right crib at just the right price and I am very, very happy with the result.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very solid, Not difficult to assemble
reviews.reviewText: Our little one hasn't made her appearance yet, but we're really excited about this crib. It's very heavy, so unless you can handle getting it inside by yourself make sure you have someone lined up to help you the day it's being delivered. I got mine inside the door then opened it there and carried all the various pieces upstairs, which wasn't too bad. It just meant it had to be done on the day it showed up.As far as assembly, it took me around 2.5 hours to do it by myself. My wife offered moral support but that was about the limit. The instructions weren't always the best. There are a lot of pre-drilled holes in the frame so that the crib can be converted to the daybed, toddler bed, and then to the headboard/foot-board of a full size bed, so it was sometimes confusing which hole out of 3 you were supposed to be putting the bolt through. At the end of the day, though, if you were assembling it correctly then it made it obvious what screw went where. Two assembly points. First, during the assembly of the shelves, at one point it says you need to lay the whole dresser part on its side. This wasn't necessary, I put all the pieces in with it standing upright with no problem. Because I had all the pieces sitting around it, there was no way I could have tipped it over. Second, if possible, assemble it in the center of the room then move it against the wall. There are some screws that go in the back of it that were really difficult to get in without good access to all four sides of the crib.Pros:Very SturdyNice clean finished lookNice size changing table (with pad included)Pre-drilledCons:Not the best instructionsVery heavy/hard to moveLots of extra pieces to store for when you want to convert the bed to its other forms

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Well let me be the first to say that this crib combo is well built the finish is really nice and is very sturdy came with a ton of hardware to put the thing together with and is well worth the money however on the pricey side it should last for years to come i haven't turned it into the other combinations of a bed but it should be just as nice anyone else expecting when they get it put together just put the extra parts in the closet like I did and in the future your set that was the good heres the bad it does take some time to assemble took me about 3hrs once I finally got it inside this thing is heavy and the directions are a little confusing you really need to pay attention on the little numbers on all the pieces because they don't interchange from both sides the manufacturer should make the instructions a little more detailed but if you are anyway mechanical inclined and have some basic hand tool knowledge you will be just fine assembling this thing that all being said we love it and is going to be all my little girl will need for a bed for years to come UpdateHas been over 2 years and this crib combo is still going strong my little girl loves it and has just started jumping on the bed I like it so much I bought my son the same thing just in a different color as of today 4/18/23 I just got the rails and a full size mattress and box springs for her to turn it into a full size and I found on Amazon some brackets that turn the full size rails into a queen that way am definitely going to get my money out of itConAnd it's not really a con the spring for the kids mattress has left my little girl still sleepy when she gets up in the morning so box spring is a must

reviews.reviewTitle: Couldn't find a better Crib/Changer combination !
reviews.reviewText: We found this crib on Sears website and really liked it because the change table was straight instead of the more common side changing setup. Obviously we checked around to see if it was cheaper somewhere else and found it here on Amazon.Like a lot of the other great reviews on this crib/change table, it came in a pretty beat up package but the way it was double boxed and wrapped in foam and packed with styrofoam, nothing was damaged. All the pieces were there as well.It's actually made from solid wood and is very sturdy. I like to think that I'm decently good at assembling things and this thing took about 3 hours to put together. The instructions were pretty good but I did get ahead of myself on a few pages and had to disassemble a step or two. Make sure you do it exactly as it shows...do not try to assemble without instructions!In the picture you can see open holes everywhere and it looks like you can see all of the screws and bolts and what-not but when it's assembled it looks better than the picture.It comes with a change table pad. It's a bit thin (so my wife says) but as a guy it looks like it should do the trick just fine.If anyone is curious, it does not come with a mattress but it fits your regular Walmart size crib/baby mattress.You can adjust the height of the mattress with a little effort. The top setting would/will be perfect for a newborn. I can see when the child gets a bit older that they'll want to start climbing onto the change table part of this crib so that's something to consider if you think you'll have an energetic little one!It does work to JUST have the crib or JUST the change table but you can't have both separately. If you want just the crib, you have to use one of the walls from the change table which has a bunch of drawer sliders attached to it and I personally think it would look quite ugly unless you had that side against a wall or something.On the right hand side there's shelves you can install for extra storage (behind the drawers)There are instructions to turn the thing into a bed with the half wall, and also use the two railing pieces to turn the bed into a bed with an actual mattress but you would still need to buy a frame for the mattress. You could only use the railings for a headboard and footboard (footboard?). It comes with everything else that you need to do the conversions.Overall this thing is BEAUTIFUL. I love it, my wife loves it, and our newest addition to the family is sure to love it. You won't find a better crib at this price. Just be aware, it's big. Overall 5 stars easily!

The package is heavy -- We had it delivered to the garage and then carried the pieces individually upstairs. Much easier than carrying the entire box. Assembly was easy (under 2.5 hours) once all of the components were identified and organized. No issues with missing pieces. You will need a lot of room to assemble this crib (we had an empty nursery). Once assembled, it's VERY nice. Quality is top notch. It's sturdy and well designed and great quality wood. Only downside is that it smells chemically/plastic-y/new. We left the window open for a few days until the smell went away. If buying, I would recommend setting it up at least a week (if not two) before the baby is due. I wouldn't want to put a newborn in the room right after assembly. Other than that, great quality at a great price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sturdy and Compact, at a great price!
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy and compact! I just finished building this crib, it took under 2 hours which was shorter than expected from all the other posts on amazon.The crib is sturdy and does not take up a lot of room which is nice to have the crib and change table in one. Shipping was fast and all the pieces were in great shape. I love how they give you all the future conversion parts in with the crib and they are not extra. Crib is sturdy, we feel we are set for the foreseeable crib needs. Highly recommended purchase!

This crib is easily worth double maybe even triple in local "baby" furniture stores.me and my wife went crib shopping the last couple weeks and every furniture store we looked at wanted an arm and a leg for a good quality crib...never mind the change table which was equally expensive...we were both turned off at the cost of these items.we both started searching online and came across this stork craft portofino 4 in 1 crib, and just by looking and the pictures and online reviews it seemed to good to be true. it was even better when we compared online prices and found amazon.ca to be the cheapest and offered free shipping!!so we ordered it on a Sunday and it arrived on Wednesday which was pretty fast especially considering the Monday was a holiday!!the package arrived in good condition. all the parts were packaged really well.assembly was just "OK" as the instructions were not the greatest. but let me tell you once you have it all assembled you will be amazed and the quality you just bought at a fraction of the cost from the furniture store. this thing is absolutely beautiful and solid. defiantly NOT a cheap piece of furniture. you will not be disappointed with this crib!one word of warning though...this thing is big...and i mean it's massive and heavy. the pictures online don't do it justice...take a good look at the measurements before you order and make sure it will fit into the space you want it.i highly recommend this crib.

Looks great in our nursery, we get compliments all the time. Reasonable to assemble, took about 3 hours for my husband. GREAT customer service from stork craft! A couple pieces were cracked/dented from shipping, just called their service hotline, and we had replacement parts in about a week! I like that the service hotline is in Vancouver, staff are very friendly and helpful. :)I wish the screws had some kind of cap/cover, but as the CS staff explained- none do to possible choking hazard- so fair enough! I just painted the screw heads white, just as well!
